name: Let It Snowball
description:
The weather outside is frightful! Light up your winter with this delightful comedy spectacular brimming with glee and holiday cheer! 

Enjoy a merry mix of classic sketches from our celebrated archives, hilarious new material, and the uproarious improv antics that have made us legendary. It's a perfect way to add laughter and joy to your holiday season!

name: The Unauthorized Hallmark(ish) Parody Musical
description:
A hilarious immersive Broadway-style show that blends your favourite holiday movie tropes with high-octane pop showtunes. 

Directed by Tim Drucker of Friends Parody Musical, Trixie and Katya LIVE and choreographed by Brooke Engen of Hairspray, Beetlejuice, Rock of Ages, with additional creatives to be announced. 

Be amongst the first to see it!

name: Environment, Climate & Forestry's Climate Action Capacity Building Programs Webinar
description: Join this session to learn about the climate action programs offered by the City of Toronto's Environment, Climate & Forestry division. The city offers a number of programs to support resident-led climate action initiatives; this includes the Indigenous Climate Action Grants, Neighbourhood Climate Action Champions Program, Neighbourhood Climate Action Grants, PollinateTO Grants, Women4Climate Toronto Mentorship Program and Youth Climate Action Grants. These programs support capacity building and enable climate action projects that have the power to effect change at the local level. Learn more about how these programs support residents across the city.

name: Don Ross and Julie Malia
description:
The new musical partnership, between these two seasoned performers. 

While continuing to play solo internationally, Don and Julie have been performing many of their shows as a double bill since the fall of 2023. In 2024, they gave 45 concert performances in Germany, the UK, Canada and the USA. They have continued their partnership in 2025, having toured together on both sides of the Atlantic.

Don Ross was born and raised in Montreal and has lived in various parts of Canada over the course of his life. The son of a Mi'kmaw Indigenous mother and a Scottish-immigrant father, he graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts (Music) degree from Toronto's York University and started working full-time as a musician in 1988.

Julie Malia is a highly talented guitarist, singer and songwriter who has made a name for herself in recent years with great compositions and impressive festival appearances.

name: Queer Emo Nite TO
description:
Toronto's queerest, saddest and wildest party, bring your most fabulous outfits down to the mosh pit and make some new queer sad friends!

Get ready for a night filled with your favourite emo tunes, queer anthems, and of course, a drag show!

name: The Taste of Iceland Festival
description: Returning to Toronto with events across the city that showcase the best of Icelandic culture, including food, music, nature, design, comedy, travel, and more.

name: Bringing in Abundance: A Sacred Hypnotic Circle
description:
Join us for an evening of deep relaxation and manifestation.

More than ever, we are in a time that requires us to be vigilant of our thoughts and our money mindset. This event is a unique opportunity to put all that worry aside, and call on your subconscious mind for assistance.

In this relaxing hypnotic circle, we will be using our subconscious to invite in abundance, of all forms, into your life. Esné will guide you to safely explore your deep inner mind and gently release your fears and anxieties around abundance of all kinds. Discover what is really holding you back and harness the power of your mind to bring your wealth goals to fruition.

name: St. Lawrence Market's Winter Market

location.name: St. Lawrence Market,  95 Front St. East

description:
Experience the magic of the season at St. Lawrence Market's 2nd Annual Winter Market. Thurs to Sun + Mon, Dec 22.

Market Street transforms into a festive winter wonderland filled with twinkling lights, evergreen garlands and cozy wooden huts. Enjoy live entertainment, indulge in seasonal eats like roasted chestnuts and warm drinks, and shop for handcrafted gifts and artisanal treasures from local vendors. Sip a spiked hot chocolate or mulled wine from the licensed outdoor bars, snap a free photo with Santa on Saturdays and Sundays from 12–3 p.m. (starting November 29), and take home a taste of Toronto's holiday spirit.

Enjoy a rotating lineup of free attractions every Friday-Sunday (listed below), and shop 75+ makers and vintage vendors at the Weekend Holiday Vendor Market (Saturdays & Sundays) in the temporary tent located at 125 The Esplanade.  A perfect holiday outing for families, food lovers and festive explorers alike!

name: Adrian Raso
description:
A musician whose playing is as stylish and distinctive as the well-cut suits he wears, Adrian Raso is a Canadian original.

His latest album, The Devil Rides Again is a collaboration with Romanian Roma brass band Fanfare Ciocărlia, which topped the European World Music charts and demonstrated his gift for composing and playing with musicians from different cultures.

A virtuoso string musician who refuses to rely on his technique, Adrian Raso undertakes adventures in sound. His unique style finds him blending jazz and rockabilly, Latin grooves and Balkan brass, Italian folk and funk, country and classical, soul and surf, always emphasising melody, lyricism and dynamic rhythms.

name: Toronto Polish Film Festival EKRAN
description:
Welcome to the 25th edition!

No Polish? No problem, every film subtitled in English, experience the stories without barriers.

name: Christmas Book Sale
description:
Getting into the holiday spirit? 

From fiction to non-fiction, children's books to adult literature, art books, cookbooks, magazines, CDs, DVDs and so much more, don't miss this chance to find the perfect holiday gift for your loved ones. 

All proceeds are donated to support Toronto Public Library programs.

name: How to Share an Egg: A Heartfelt Conversation with Bonny Reichert
description:
Join us for a heartfelt conversation and discover the stories, memories, and flavours behind this moving culinary memoir.

About the relationship between food and family, sustenance and survival, from Bonny Reichert, award-winning Canadian journalist and daughter of a Holocaust survivor.

Bonny Reichert avoided everything to do with the Holocaust until she found herself, in midlife, suddenly typing those words into an article she was writing. The journalist had grown up hearing stories about her father's near-starvation and ultimate survival in Auschwitz-Birkenau, but she never imagined she would be able to face this epic legacy head on.

Then a chance encounter with a perfect bowl of borscht in Warsaw set Bonny on a journey to unearth her culinary lineage, and she began to dig for the roots of her food obsession, dish by dish. "How to Share an Egg" is a journey of deep flavors and surprising contrasts.

name: Romeo and Juliet
description:
Step into the timeless tale of love and tragedy with Prokofiev's Romeo and Juliet, masterfully brought to life in this live-recorded performance.

Matthew-John Knights's Lines, Layers, Ligaments explores the intricate connections between the human body and the natural world, and Prokofiev's Symphony No. 3 stirs with gripping drama and intensity.

name: Etobicoke Humane Society Benefit Show
description:
Join us for a night of music, laughter and good vibes, while supporting a great cause. 

Get ready to groove to some awesome tunes and enjoy the company of fellow animal lovers. Let's come together to make a difference for our furry friends.

Enjoy performances by Fiona Dunbar, J Noir and Yian Wants to Bass.

name: Thermo Duo
description:
Co-leaders, Mike Manny (a first generation Canadian of Caribbean descent, born in Toronto, living in Ottawa), and Nathan Hiltz (originally from Antigonish and living in Toronto) formed THERMO during the pandemic after performing guitar-piano duo shows online via the magic of cyberspace through the low latency Canadian internet platform, Syncspace.live. 

A musical kinship blossomed and musical ideas were put into motion. Suddenly, a few live performances took place and a recording date was set, all to include legendary Canadian jazz bassist, Neil Swainson, and the deep swinging Morgan Childs on drums.

THERMO's debut recording, "Birdlike" recently won a Global Music Award 2023 (Jazz Category), and features outstanding arrangements performed in synchronous motion by Manny and Hiltz; a style not often heard on modern Canadian jazz recordings.

name: Blood in the Snow: Funny Frights 2025
description:
Get ready to laugh, squirm, and scream! Enjoy a showcase of Canadian shorts highlighting the unusual, the surreal, and the lighter side of horror.

Featuring: Weeds (Dir. Stefano Toniatti), Cherry on Top (Dir. Lulu Liu), Ultra Cheese (Dir. Kyle Dunbar), Steal My Life (Dir. Annie Wren), Blood Rights (Dir. Caitlin Starowicz), As Pale As Death (Dir. Ryan Kukec), Seed (Dir. Cameron Macgowan), WFH (Dir. James Watts), Bidet (Dir. James Brylowski) and Shrimp Fried Rice (Dir. Dylan Pun).

Programmed by Kassy Gascho and Nadine L'Esperance.
